headline: Why CME Group (CME) Is Up 6.5% After Expanding Into New Altcoin Futures Offerings
summary: CME Group recently announced plans to launch futures contracts tied to Cardano (ADA), Chainlink (LINK), and Stellar (Lumens) on February 9, 2026, pending regulatory approval, offering both standard and micro-sized contracts that sit alongside its existing Bitcoin, Ether, XRP, and Solana derivatives. This push into additional altcoin futures underlines CME Group’s effort to broaden regulated crypto risk-management tools for institutional and retail users, reinforcing its role as a central...

headline: Is CME Group (CME) Pricing Look Stretched After Strong Multi Year Share Gains
summary: If you are looking at CME Group and wondering whether the recent price makes sense, you are not alone. This article walks through what that price could imply about value. CME Group last closed at US$279.50, with returns of 6.5% over the past 7 days, 3.9% over 30 days, 3.6% year to date, 22.4% over 1 year, 78.6% over 3 years, and 83.6% over 5 years, which gives plenty of data points for thinking about what investors may be pricing in. Recent coverage around CME Group has focused on its role...
